greater_cloud_invocation.name: Greater Cloud Invocation
description: ## Greater Cloud Invocation
{SOURCE Heroes from the Fringe/9}
Your devotion to the {family/cloud dragon/s} of your kingdom causes your connection with them to strengthen.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Cloud Invocation}, Mbe'ke {race/dwarf}.

**Benefit:** The duration of your Cloud Invocation increases to 1 minute per level, and you can dismiss it as an immediate action. You can create mist with your Cloud Invocation ability multiple times per day, so long as you do not exceed a total duration of 1 minute per level, and you expend the duration of your Cloud Invocation in 1-minute increments. If you create a mist cloud while any previous mist is still present, the previous mist ends. Additionally, you can have the mist remain centered on you, rather than stationary.

greater_dirge_of_doom.name: Greater Dirge of Doom
description: ## Greater Dirge of Doom
{SOURCE Advanced Class Guide/149}
The haunting sound of sepulchral intonations chills the most stalwart adversary to its very core.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Improved Dirge of Doom}, ability to perform {performance/dirge of doom}.

**Benefit:** The effect of your dirge of doom lingers with a target for 2 rounds after the creature leaves the dirge's area of effect. If you use your dirge on a creature that is {misc/shaken}, it becomes {misc/frightened}. If you use it on a creature that is frightened, it becomes {misc/panicked}. Once affected by this feat, a creature cannot be affected by it again for 24 hours.

**Normal:** Fear effects on a creature end immediately once it leaves the area of dirge of doom. A fear effect cannot be made more extreme by dirge of doom and can be changed only to the frightened condition by the Improved Dirge of Doom feat.

greater_dirty_trick.name: Greater Dirty Trick
description: ## Greater Dirty Trick (Combat)
{SOURCE Advanced Player's Guide/161}
When you pull a dirty trick, your foe is truly hindered.
**Prerequisites:** Int 13, {feat/Combat Expertise}, {feat/Improved Dirty Trick}, base attack bonus +6.

**Benefit:** You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to attempt a {rule/dirty trick}. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by {feat/Improved Dirty Trick}. Whenever you successfully perform a dirty trick, the penalty lasts for 1d4 rounds, plus 1 round for every 5 by which your attack exceeds the target's CMD. In addition, removing the condition requires the target to spend a standard action.

**Normal:** The condition imposed by a dirty trick lasts for 1 round plus 1 round for every 5 by which your attack exceeds the target's CMD. Removing the condition requires the target to spend a move action.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/120}

>You can select this feat even if you don't meet the ability score prerequisite (Intelligence 13). You gain the benefits of this feat only as long as you have at least 1 stamina point in your stamina pool. When you successfully complete a dirty trick combat maneuver, you can spend 5 stamina points to make the condition you inflicted with that maneuver require a full-round action to remove (instead of a standard action).

greater_disarm.name: Greater Disarm
description: ## Greater Disarm (Combat)
{SOURCE PRPG Core Rulebook/125}
You can knock weapons far from an enemy's grasp.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Combat Expertise}, {feat/Improved Disarm}, base attack bonus +6, Int 13.

**Benefit:** You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to {rule/disarm} a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Disarm. Whenever you successfully disarm an opponent, the weapon lands 15 feet away from its previous wielder, in a random direction.
**Normal:** Disarmed weapons and gear land at the feet of the disarmed creature.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/120}

>You can select this feat even if you don't meet the ability score prerequisite (Intelligence 13). You gain the benefits of this feat only as long as you have at least 1 stamina point in your stamina pool. When you successfully disarm a foe, you can spend 5 stamina points to select where the weapon lands by choosing a square within 15 feet of the disarmed foe. If you choose a square in your space and have at least one hand free, you can grab the weapon as part of the disarm attempt.

greater_dispel_focus.name: Greater Dispel Focus
description: ## Greater Dispel Focus
{SOURCE Monster Summoner's Handbook/9}
You are a master of the art of dispelling.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Dispel Focus}, ability to cast {spell/dispel magic}.
**Benefit:** Whenever you attempt a dispel check based on your caster level, you gain a +2 bonus to the check. This stacks with the bonus from Dispel Focus.

greater_drag.name: Greater Drag
description: ## Greater Drag (Combat)
{SOURCE Advanced Player's Guide/161}
Foes that you drag are thrown out of balance.
**Prerequisites:** Str 13, {feat/Improved Drag}, {feat/Power Attack}, base attack bonus +6.

**Benefit:** You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to {rule/drag} a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Drag. Whenever you drag a foe, his movement provokes attacks of opportunity from all of your allies (but not you).
**Normal:** Creatures moved by drag do not provoke attacks of opportunity.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/121}

>When you succeed at a drag combat maneuver check, you can spend 5 stamina points to gain up to 10 feet of movement for your drag. You can use this movement in place of your normal movement, but only to drag an opponent.

greater_drow_nobility.name: Greater Drow Nobility
description: ## Greater Drow Nobility
{SOURCE Advanced Race Guide/105}
You have mastered the lesser spell-like abilities of the drow, demonstrating true nobility.
**Prerequisites:** Cha 13, {feat/Drow Nobility}, {feat/Improved Drow Nobility}, able to use drow spell-like abilities, {race/drow}.

**Benefit:** Your {spell/detect magic} spell-like ability is now constant. You may use your {spell/dancing lights}, {spell/deeper darkness}, {spell/faerie fire}, {spell/feather fall}, and {spell/levitate} spell-like abilities at will.

greater_eldritch_heritage.name: Greater Eldritch Heritage
description: ## Greater Eldritch Heritage
{SOURCE Ultimate Magic/152}
Your discovered bloodline power reaches its zenith.
**Prerequisites:** Cha 17, {feat/Eldritch Heritage}, {feat/Improved Eldritch Heritage}, character level 17th.

**Benefit:** You gain an additional power from the {ability/sorcerer_<bloodline>s} you selected with the Eldritch Heritage feat. You gain a 15th-level (or lower) sorcerer bloodline power that you do not already have. For purposes of using that power, treat your character level as your sorcerer level for all your sorcerer bloodline powers granted by this feat, Eldritch Heritage, and Improved Eldritch Heritage.

greater_elemental_focus.name: Greater Elemental Focus
description: ## Greater Elemental Focus
{SOURCE Advanced Player's Guide/161}
Choose an energy type to which you have already applied the Elemental Focus feat. Any spells you cast of this energy type are very hard to resist.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Elemental Focus}.
**Benefit:** Add +1 to the Difficulty Class for all saving throws against spells that deal damage of the energy type you select. This bonus stacks with the bonus from Elemental Focus.
**Special:** You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take this feat, it applies to a new energy type to which you have already applied the Elemental Focus feat.

greater_feint.name: Greater Feint
description: ## Greater Feint (Combat)
{SOURCE PRPG Core Rulebook/125}
You are skilled at making foes overreact to your attacks.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Combat Expertise}, {feat/Improved Feint}, base attack bonus +6, Int 13.

**Benefit:** Whenever you use {rule/feint} to cause an opponent to lose his Dexterity bonus, he loses that bonus until the beginning of your next turn, in addition to losing his Dexterity bonus against your next attack.
**Normal:** A creature you feint loses its Dexterity bonus against your next attack.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/121}

>You can select this feat even if you don't meet the ability score prerequisite (Intelligence 13). You gain the benefits of this feat only as long as you have at least 1 stamina point in your stamina pool. If you have at least 1 point in your stamina pool, you can feint as a swift action, but the feint causes the opponent to become {rule/flat-footed} only for your next attack rather than for all attacks until the beginning of your next turn.

greater_gathlain_magic.name: Greater Gathlain Magic
description: ## Greater Gathlain Magic
{SOURCE Ultimate Wilderness/13}
You have greatly developed your innate magical abilities.
**Prerequisites:** Cha 15, {feat/Advanced Gathlain Magic}, character level 9th, {race/gathlain}.
**Benefit:** You gain the following spells as spell-like abilities, each of which are usable 1/day: {spell/command plants}, {spell/thorny entanglement}.

greater_grapple.name: Greater Grapple
description: ## Greater Grapple (Combat)
{SOURCE PRPG Core Rulebook/125}
Maintaining a grapple is second nature to you.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Improved Grapple}, {feat/Improved Unarmed Strike}, base attack bonus +6, Dex 13.

**Benefit:** You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to {misc/grapple} a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by {feat/Improved Grapple}. Once you have grappled a creature, maintaining the grapple is a move action. This feat allows you to make two grapple checks each round (to move, harm, or pin your opponent), but you are not required to make two checks. You only need to succeed at one of these checks to maintain the grapple.
**Normal:** Maintaining a grapple is a standard action.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/121}

>After you take a move action to successfully maintain a grapple, you can spend 5 stamina points before the end of your turn to maintain that grapple as a swift action. This allows you to make up to three grapple checks to maintain a grapple during a round, but you still can't maintain a grapple until the round after you initiate it.

greater_hunters_bond.name: Greater Hunter's Bond
description: ## Greater Hunter's Bond (Combat)
{SOURCE Ultimate Wilderness/113}
Your allies can target additional foes.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Improved Hunter's Bond}, hunter's bond (hunting companions) class feature, {class/ranger} level 12th.
**Benefit:** When you activate hunter's bond, you can select a number of targets equal to your Wisdom modifier as long as they all count as your {ability/favored enemy}.
**Normal:** You select one target against which your allies receive your favored enemy bonus.

greater_ironclad_reactions.name: Greater Ironclad Reactions
description: ## Greater Ironclad Reactions (Armor Mastery, Combat)
{SOURCE Armor Master's Handbook/16}
You are able to quickly react to attacks.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Combat Reflexes}, {feat/Ironclad Reactions}, base attack bonus +11 or fighter level 8th, armor training class feature, proficiency with medium armor.

**Benefit:** You can use Ironclad Reactions more than once per round, but not more than once for each act you take that provokes an attack of opportunity. Each 5-foot step you take still counts as expending one use of an attack of opportunity.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Armor Master's Handbook/20}
>You can spend 5 stamina points to use this feat without it counting against your maximum number of attacks of opportunity for that round.

greater_meditation_master.name: Greater Meditation Master
description: ## Greater Meditation Master (Meditation)
{SOURCE Blood of the Beast/28}
You are able to glean insight from your momentary meditation longer than most.
**Prerequisites:** Wis 15, {feat/Combat Meditation}, {feat/Meditation Master}, character level 11th.

**Benefit:** When you meditate, you gain a +2 insight bonus instead of a +1 insight bonus. You can split this bonus between any two d20 rolls made over the duration of the feat that you used to meditate, adding +1 to each d20 roll, or using the full bonus on any one d20 roll, adding +2 to that single roll.

greater_mercy.name: Greater Mercy
description: ## Greater Mercy
{SOURCE Ultimate Magic/152}
Your mercy has incredible recuperative properties.
**Prerequisites:** Cha 13, {ability/lay on hands} class feature, mercy class feature.

**Benefit:** When you use your lay on hands ability and the target of that ability does not have any conditions your {ability/mercies} can remove, it instead heals an additional +1d6 points of damage.

greater_mesmerizing_feint.name: Greater Mesmerizing Feint
description: ## Greater Mesmerizing Feint (Combat)
{SOURCE Occult Adventures/134}
You can feint against nearly any creature.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Mesmerizing Feint}, Bluff 10 ranks, hypnotic stare class feature, {stare/psychic inception} bold stare.

**Benefit:** You can {rule/feint} against mindless creatures at a -4 penalty. Such a creature must be a subject of your hypnotic stare, and the creature has a 50% chance of ignoring the effects of your feint.
**Normal:** Feinting against a creature that is mindless is impossible.

greater_overrun.name: Greater Overrun
description: ## Greater Overrun (Combat)
{SOURCE PRPG Core Rulebook/125}
Enemies must dive to avoid your dangerous move.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Improved Overrun}, {feat/Power Attack}, base attack bonus +6, Str 13.

**Benefit:** You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to overrun a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by {feat/Improved Overrun}. Whenever you {rule/overrun} opponents, they provoke attacks of opportunity if they are knocked {rule/prone} by your overrun.
**Normal:** Creatures knocked prone by your overrun do not provoke an attack of opportunity.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/121}
>If you succeed at a combat maneuver check to overrun an opponent, but do not exceed your opponent's CMD by 5 or more, you can spend 2 stamina points to knock the target prone anyway.

greater_penetrating_strike.name: Greater Penetrating Strike
description: ## Greater Penetrating Strike (Combat)
{SOURCE PRPG Core Rulebook/125}
Your attacks penetrate the defenses of most foes.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Penetrating Strike}, {feat/Weapon Focus}, 16th-level fighter.

**Benefit:** Your attacks with weapons selected with {feat/Weapon Focus} ignore up to 10 points of damage reduction. This amount is reduced to 5 points for damage reduction without a type (such as DR 10/-).
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/121}

>When you use a weapon with which you have Weapon Focus to damage a creature that has damage reduction, you can spend 5 stamina points to allow all your allies within 30 feet to ignore 10 points of that creature's damage reduction for 1 round. This amount is reduced to 5 points for damage reduction without a type (such as DR 10/-). This effect does not stack with Greater Penetrating Strike's normal effect, but it does allow you to apply the effect to all your other weapons for the duration.

greater_planar_infusion.name: Greater Planar Infusion
description: ## Greater Planar Infusion (Conduit)
{SOURCE Planar Adventures/28}
You have mastered the powers of another plane.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Improved Planar Infusion}, {feat/Planar Infusion}, character level 13th.
**Benefit:** Choose a plane for which you've gained an improved infusion via Improved Planar Infusion. You gain that plane's greater infusion as well.

greater_planar_mentor.name: Greater Planar Mentor
description: ## Greater Planar Mentor
{SOURCE Plane-Hopper's Handbook/26}
Your mentor begins to look upon you as an equal and can even answer your call.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Improved Planar Mentor}, {feat/Planar Mentor}, character level 13th.

**Benefit:** You can benefit from your {feat/Planar Mentor} feat one additional time per day. You add the following to the list of spell-like abilities you can cast using Improved Planar Mentor for their respective alignments, each of which affects only a single target within 30 feet: {spell/blasphemy} (evil), {spell/dictum} (lawful), {spell/holy word} (good), {spell/slay living} (neutral), and {spell/word of chaos} (chaotic).
Once per week you can cast {spell/greater planar ally} as a spell-like ability, but only to conjure your planar mentor. Your mentor requires only half the normal payment for its services.

greater_ray_shield.name: Greater Ray Shield
description: ## Greater Ray Shield (Combat, Shield Mastery)
{SOURCE Armor Master's Handbook/18}
You can turn your shield to deflect rays and other ranged attacks without harming it.
**Prerequisites:** Dex 17, {feat/Missile Shield}, {feat/Ray Shield}, {feat/Spellbreaker}.
**Benefit:** When you use the Ray Shield feat, your shield is not affected by the deflected ranged touch attack.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Armor Master's Handbook/20}

>When you successfully deflect a ranged touch attack, you can spend 10 stamina points as a swift or immediate action to reflect the attack toward another target, which must be within 60 feet of you. The total distance from the original attacker, to you, and then to the new target cannot exceed the original attack's maximum range. You take a -5 penalty on the ranged touch attack to hit the new target.

greater_rending_fury.name: Greater Rending Fury
description: ## Greater Rending Fury (Combat)
{SOURCE Ultimate Combat/103}
When your claws latch on to an opponent, the effect is bloody and horrific.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Improved Rending Fury}, {feat/Rending Fury}, base attack bonus +12, {umr/rend} special attack.
**Benefit:** Whenever you rend an opponent, you deal 1d6 {umr/bleed} damage to that opponent. This is an addition to the effects of the rend.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/121}
>When you rend an opponent, you can spend 2 stamina points to deal 1d6+2 points of bleed damage to your opponent instead of 1d6 points of bleed damage.

greater_reposition.name: Greater Reposition
description: ## Greater Reposition (Combat)
{SOURCE Advanced Player's Guide/161}
When you reposition foes, they are left vulnerable to the attacks of your allies.
**Prerequisites:** Int 13, {feat/Combat Expertise}, {feat/Improved Reposition}, base attack bonus +6.

**Benefit:** You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to {rule/reposition} a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by {feat/Improved Reposition}. Whenever you reposition a foe, his movement provokes attacks of opportunity from all of your allies (but not you).
**Normal:** Creatures moved by reposition do not provoke attacks of opportunity.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/121}

>You can select this feat even if you don't meet the ability score prerequisite (Intelligence 13). You gain the benefits of this feat only as long as you have at least 1 stamina point in your stamina pool. When attempting to reposition a foe, you can spend 5 stamina points to increase your melee reach by 5 feet for the purpose of determining where you can move the foe.

greater_school_familiar.name: Greater School Familiar
description: ## Greater School Familiar
{SOURCE Familiar Folio/14}
Your school familiar's powers are greater than others of its kind.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/School Familiar}, wizard level 10th, specialized arcane school class feature.
**Benefit:** Your school {sidekick/familiar} gains the greater school power from the {arc-familiar/school familiar} archetype.

greater_serpent_lash.name: Greater Serpent Lash
description: ## Greater Serpent Lash (Combat)
{SOURCE Rival Guide/23}
Your ability to disarm and pull foes off balance with your whip is impressive.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Serpent Lash}, base attack bonus +4.

**Benefit:** When you make a successful {rule/disarm} or {rule/trip} maneuver using the Serpent Lash feat, you can make your additional disarm or trip attempt against any target within your whip's reach. With a {rule/reposition} maneuver, you can move the target creature to any point within your whip's reach.

greater_shield_focus.name: Greater Shield Focus
description: ## Greater Shield Focus (Combat)
{SOURCE PRPG Core Rulebook/125}
You are skilled at deflecting blows with your shield.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Shield Focus}, {feat/Shield Proficiency}, base attack bonus +1, 8th-level fighter.
**Benefit:** Increase the AC bonus granted by any shield you are using by 1. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Shield Focus.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/121}

>When an attack is made against you while you are using a shield, you can spend up to 4 stamina points. For that attack, your shield bonus increases by an amount equal to the number of stamina points you spent. This increase does not stack with any gained from the Shield Focus combat trick.

greater_shield_specialization.name: Greater Shield Specialization
description: ## Greater Shield Specialization (Combat)
{SOURCE Advanced Player's Guide/162}
Your masterful shieldwork provides even greater protection to your vital areas.
**Prerequisites:** Proficiency with selected shield, {feat/Greater Shield Focus}, {feat/Shield Focus}, {feat/Shield Specialization} with selected shield, fighter level 12th.

**Benefit:** Choose one type of shield (buckler, light, heavy, or tower shield) for which you possess the Shield Specialization feat. With the selected shield, you gain a +2 bonus to your Armor Class against critical hit confirmation rolls (this bonus stacks with that from Shield Specialization). In addition, once per day you may negate a critical hit, and damage is instead rolled normally.
**Special:** You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of shield.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/121}
>You can spend 5 stamina points to use your selected shield to negate a critical hit a second time each day.

greater_skalds_vigor.name: Greater Skald's Vigor
description: ## Greater Skald's Vigor
{SOURCE Advanced Class Guide/149}
Your song and your enthusiasm invigorate your allies.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Skald's Vigor}, Perform (song) 10 ranks.

**Benefit:** Your allies share in the {umr/fast healing} granted by your Skald's Vigor, starting in the round when you begin your performance. They must be able to hear the performance. If you stop maintaining the song, the fast healing ends immediately, even if other effects of your song linger.

greater_snap_shot.name: Greater Snap Shot
description: ## Greater Snap Shot (Combat)
{SOURCE Ultimate Combat/103}
You can prey on any gap in your foe's guard with impunity, and with even greater range.
**Prerequisites:** Dex 17, {feat/Improved Snap Shot}, {feat/Rapid Shot}, {feat/Snap Shot}, base attack bonus +12.

**Benefit:** Whenever you make an attack of opportunity using a ranged weapon and hit, you gain a +2 bonus on the damage roll and a +2 bonus on rolls to confirm a critical hit with that attack. These bonuses increase to +4 when you have base attack bonus +16, and to +6 when you have base attack bonus +20.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/121}
>When you make an attack of opportunity using a ranged weapon, you can spend 3 stamina points to gain your bonus from Greater Snap Shot on the attack roll.

greater_spell_focus.name: Greater Spell Focus
description: ## Greater Spell Focus
{SOURCE PRPG Core Rulebook/125}
Choose a school of magic to which you have already applied the {feat/Spell Focus} feat. Any spells you cast of this school are very hard to resist.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Spell Focus}.
**Benefit:** Add +1 to the Difficulty Class for all saving throws against spells from the school of magic you select. This bonus stacks with the bonus from Spell Focus.
**Special:** You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new school to which you already have applied the Spell Focus feat.

greater_spell_penetration.name: Greater Spell Penetration
description: ## Greater Spell Penetration
{SOURCE PRPG Core Rulebook/125}
Your spells break through spell resistance much more easily than most.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Spell Penetration}.
**Benefit:** You get a +2 bonus on caster level checks (1d20 + caster level) made to overcome a creature's spell resistance. This bonus stacks with the one from Spell Penetration.

greater_spell_specialization.name: Greater Spell Specialization
description: ## Greater Spell Specialization
{SOURCE Ultimate Magic/152}
You can sacrifice a prepared spell in order to spontaneously cast your specialized spell.
**Prerequisites:** Int 13, {feat/Spell Focus}, {feat/Spell Specialization}, able to prepare 5th-level spells.

**Benefit:** By sacrificing a prepared spell of the same or higher level than your specialized spell, you may spontaneously cast your specialized spell. The specialized spell is treated as its normal level, regardless of the spell slot used to cast it. You may add a metamagic feat to the spell by increasing the spell slot and casting time, just like a {class/cleric} spontaneously casting a cure or inflict spell with a metamagic feat.

greater_spelleater.name: Greater Spelleater
description: ## Greater Spelleater
{SOURCE Wilderness Origins/12}
Your ability to defeat magic has grown stronger with use.
**Prerequisites:** Cha 13, character level 5th, {race/ghoran}, spelleater racial trait.

**Benefit:** Once per week, instead of casting {spell/dispel magic} as a spell-like ability, you can cast {spell/greater dispel magic}. This exhausts your daily use of {spell/dispel magic} granted by the spelleater racial trait. In all other respects, this ability is treated as the spelleater racial trait.

greater_spring_attack.name: Greater Spring Attack
description: ## Greater Spring Attack (Combat)
{SOURCE Ultimate Wilderness/113}
You are a scything wind cutting through the battlefield as you topple your foes.
**Prerequisites:** Dex 17, {feat/Acrobatic Steps}, {feat/Dodge}, {feat/Improved Spring Attack}, {feat/Mobility}, {feat/Nimble Moves}, {feat/Spring Attack}, base attack bonus +16.

**Benefit:** When you use Spring Attack, you can select three targets to attack during your movement instead of one. The second attack made this way is made at your full base attack bonus - 5, and the third attack made this way is made at your full base attack bonus - 10. All restrictions of Spring Attack apply to each target, and your movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity from any of your targets. You can't target the same creature more than once.
**Special:** A monk of at least 18th level can select this feat as a monk bonus feat, but only if he has Improved Spring attack and Spring Attack.

greater_steal.name: Greater Steal
description: ## Greater Steal (Combat)
{SOURCE Advanced Player's Guide/162}
You have a knack for snatching items from your opponents in combat.
**Prerequisites:** Int 13, {feat/Combat Expertise}, {feat/Improved Steal}, base attack bonus +6.

**Benefit:** You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to {rule/steal} an item from a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Steal. If you successfully steal an item from a foe during combat, it does not notice the theft until after combat is over or if it attempts to use the missing item.
**Normal:** Creatures automatically notice items taken from them through the steal combat maneuver.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/121}

>You can select this feat even if you don't meet the ability score prerequisite (Intelligence 13). You gain the benefits of this feat only as long as you have at least 1 stamina point in your stamina pool. When attempting a steal combat maneuver with a whip, you can spend 2 stamina points to negate the -4 penalty on the check.

greater_stylized_spell.name: Greater Stylized Spell
description: ## Greater Stylized Spell
{SOURCE Inner Sea Intrigue/16}
You can modify your spell's superficial qualities in a greater variety of ways.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Stylized Spell}, Bluff 10 ranks, Spellcraft 10 ranks.

**Benefit:** When you modify a spell with Stylized Spell, you can apply one of the stylized magic options (see the {feat/Stylized Spell} metamagic feat) without reducing the DC of the check to identify the spell. In addition, you can apply up to two additional stylized magic options, reducing the DC of checks to identify the spell by 5 per option as normal.

greater_subjective_slam.name: Greater Subjective Slam
description: ## Greater Subjective Slam (Combat)
{SOURCE Planar Adventures/28}
Your gravitational impact is meteoric, and your ability to use the act of falling devastating.
**Prerequisites:** Con 15; Wis 15; {feat/Subjective Mobility}; {feat/Subjective Slam}; base attack bonus +8 or monk level 7th.
**Benefit:** When using Subjective Slam, you take only a -1 penalty on the combat maneuver check for every 100 feet of falling speed, and the maximum damage for such a slam increases to 12d6.

greater_sunder.name: Greater Sunder
description: ## Greater Sunder (Combat)
{SOURCE PRPG Core Rulebook/125}
Your devastating strikes cleave through weapons and armor and into their wielders, damaging both item and wielder alike in a single terrific strike.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Improved Sunder}, {feat/Power Attack}, base attack bonus +6, Str 13.

**Benefit:** You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to {rule/sunder} an item. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Sunder. Whenever you sunder to destroy a weapon, shield, or suit of armor, any excess damage is applied to the item's wielder. No damage is transferred if you decide to leave the item with 1 hit point.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/121}

>When you succeed at a sunder combat maneuver check, you can spend a number of stamina points up to your Strength bonus to deal an amount of extra damage to the target equal to double the number of stamina points you spent. The damage type is the same as that of the weapon you used to attempt the maneuver.

greater_tenacious_hunter.name: Greater Tenacious Hunter
description: ## Greater Tenacious Hunter
{SOURCE Ultimate Wilderness/218}
The animal is capable of savaging hidden foes when they least expect it.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Combat Reflexes}, {feat/Tenacious Hunter}, Perception 3 ranks, Stealth 3 ranks, {sidekick/animal companion}.

**Benefit:** The animal companion can attempt a Perception check as a swift action to intentionally search for a stimulus. When using Perception to attempt to pinpoint an invisible foe, the animal companion's bonus from the Tenacious Hunter feat increases to +20. In addition, whenever the animal companion successfully uses Perception to oppose a Stealth check or to pinpoint an invisible creature's location, that foe is denied its Dexterity bonus to AC against all attacks that the animal companion makes before the start of the animal companion's next turn.
**Normal:** Using Perception to intentionally search for a stimulus is a move action.

greater_trip.name: Greater Trip
description: ## Greater Trip (Combat)
{SOURCE PRPG Core Rulebook/126}
You can make free attacks on foes that you knock down.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Combat Expertise}, {feat/Improved Trip}, base attack bonus +6, Int 13.

**Benefit:** You receive a +2 bonus on checks made to {rule/trip} a foe. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Trip. Whenever you successfully trip an opponent, that opponent provokes attacks of opportunity.
**Normal:** Creatures do not provoke attacks of opportunity from being tripped.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/122}

>You can select this feat even if you don't meet the ability score prerequisite (Intelligence 13). You gain the benefits of this feat only as long as you have at least 1 stamina point in your stamina pool. You can spend 2 stamina points after you successfully trip an opponent to deal 1d6 points of falling damage to the target.

greater_two_weapon_fighting.name: Greater Two-Weapon Fighting
description: ## Greater Two-Weapon Fighting (Combat)
{SOURCE PRPG Core Rulebook/126}
You are incredibly skilled at fighting with two weapons at the same time.
**Prerequisites:** Dex 19, {feat/Improved Two-Weapon Fighting}, {feat/Two-Weapon Fighting}, base attack bonus +11.
**Benefit:** You get a third attack with your off-hand weapon, albeit at a -10 penalty.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/122}
>If you hit with the third attack granted by this feat and your base attack bonus is 16 or higher, you can spend 2 stamina points to make another attack with your off hand at a -15 penalty.

greater_uncivilized_tactics.name: Greater Uncivilized Tactics
description: ## Greater Uncivilized Tactics (Combat)
{SOURCE Heroes of the Wild/23}
Your foes find it difficult to recover from your rough-and-tumble combat style and debilitating attacks.
**Prerequisites:** Str 13, {feat/Improved Uncivilized Tactics}, {feat/Power Attack}, {feat/Uncivilized Tactics}.

**Benefit:** You gain a +2 bonus on checks to use Uncivilized Tactics. This bonus stacks with the bonus granted by Improved Uncivilized Tactics. Additionally, a foe must take a full-round action to recover the use of a limb or natural attack you've incapacitated with Uncivilized Tactics.
**Normal:** As a standard action, a foe can regain the use of a limb or natural attack incapacitated with Uncivilized Tactics.

greater_vital_strike.name: Greater Vital Strike
description: ## Greater Vital Strike (Combat)
{SOURCE PRPG Core Rulebook/126}
You can make a single attack that deals incredible damage.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Improved Vital Strike}, {feat/Vital Strike}, base attack bonus +16.

**Benefit:** When you use the attack action, you can make one attack at your highest base attack bonus that deals additional damage. Roll the weapon's damage dice for the attack four times and add the results together before adding bonuses from Strength, weapon abilities (such as {magic-enh/flaming}), precision based damage, and other damage bonuses. These extra weapon damage dice are not multiplied on a critical hit, but are added to the total.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/122}
>When using the Vital Strike combat trick, you can spend 4 stamina points instead of 2 to reroll four damage dice.

greater_weapon_focus.name: Greater Weapon Focus
description: ## Greater Weapon Focus (Combat)
{SOURCE PRPG Core Rulebook/126}
Choose one type of weapon (including unarmed strike or grapple) for which you have already selected Weapon Focus. You are a master at your chosen weapon.
**Prerequisites:** Proficiency with selected weapon, {feat/Weapon Focus} with selected weapon, base attack bonus +1, 8th-level fighter.
**Benefit:** You gain a +1 bonus on attack rolls you make using the selected weapon. This bonus stacks with other bonuses on attack rolls, including those from Weapon Focus.
**Special:** You can gain Greater Weapon Focus multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/122}
>Once per round, you can spend 2 stamina points to gain your Greater Weapon Focus bonus on attack rolls with another weapon. This bonus lasts until the start of your next turn.

greater_weapon_of_the_chosen.name: Greater Weapon of the Chosen
description: ## Greater Weapon of the Chosen (Combat)
{SOURCE Advanced Class Guide/149}
Your deity guides your hand when you fight with her favored weapon.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Improved Weapon of the Chosen}, {feat/Weapon Focus} with deity's favored weapon, {feat/Weapon of the Chosen}, worship and receive spells from a deity.

**Benefit:** When you use your deity's favored weapon to attempt a single attack with the attack action, you roll two dice for your attack roll and take the higher result. You do not need to use your Weapon of the Chosen feat to gain this feat's benefit. As usual, the reroll does not apply to any confirmation rolls.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/122}
>When making an attack as part of a full attack with the weapon designated by your Weapon of the Chosen feat, you can spend 5 stamina points to gain the benefits of this feat on that attack.

greater_weapon_shift.name: Greater Weapon Shift
description: ## Greater Weapon Shift
{SOURCE Wilderness Origins/9}
In animal form, your natural attacks are as deadly as the weapons you were holding.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Improved Weapon Shift}, {feat/Weapon Shift}, base attack bonus +8, wild shape class feature.

**Benefit:** When you apply a melee weapon's damage type and properties to your natural attacks using the {feat/Weapon Shift} feat, your natural attacks also gain an enhancement bonus on attack and damage rolls equal to the enhancement bonus (if any) of the weapon.

greater_weapon_specialization.name: Greater Weapon Specialization
description: ## Greater Weapon Specialization (Combat)
{SOURCE PRPG Core Rulebook/126}
Choose one type of weapon (including unarmed strike or grapple) for which you possess the Weapon Specialization feat. Your attacks with the chosen weapon are more devastating than normal.

**Prerequisites:** Proficiency with selected weapon, {feat/Greater Weapon Focus} with selected weapon, {feat/Weapon Focus} with selected weapon, {feat/Weapon Specialization} with selected weapon, 12th-level fighter.
**Benefit:** You gain a +2 bonus on all damage rolls you make using the selected weapon. This bonus to damage stacks with other damage roll bonuses, including any you gain from Weapon Specialization.
**Special:** You can gain Greater Weapon Specialization multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/122}
>Once per round, you can spend 2 stamina points to gain your Greater Weapon Specialization bonus on damage rolls with another weapon. This bonus lasts until the start of your next turn.

greater_whip_mastery.name: Greater Whip Mastery
description: ## Greater Whip Mastery (Combat)
{SOURCE Ultimate Combat/103}
You can use a whip to make combat maneuvers with ease.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Improved Whip Mastery}, {feat/Whip Mastery}, base attack bonus +8.

**Benefit:** You are so quick with your {eq-weapon/whip} that you never drop it due to a failed {rule/disarm} or {rule/trip} combat maneuver attempt. Further, you gain the ability to {rule/grapple} using your whip. To do so, use the normal grapple rules with the following changes.
>@HL[Attack:] You cannot use your whip to attack while you are using it to grapple an opponent.
>@HL[Damage:] When dealing damage to your grappled opponent, you deal your whip's weapon damage rather than your unarmed strike damage.
>@HL[Free Hands:] You take no penalty on your combat maneuver check for having fewer than two hands free when you use your whip to grapple.

>@HL[Reach:] Rather than pulling your grappled opponent adjacent to you when you successfully grapple and when you move the grapple, you must keep him within your whip's reach minus his own reach to maintain the grapple. If the difference in reach is less than 0, such as is the case for a Medium whip wielder and a Gargantuan creature, you cannot grapple that opponent with your whip. If you have to pull a creature adjacent to you to grapple it with your whip, you still provoke an attack of opportunity from that opponent unless you have the {feat/Improved Grapple} feat.

>@HL[Tie Up:] While adjacent to your opponent, you can attempt to use your whip to tie him up. If you do so to an opponent you have grappled rather than pinned, you take only a -5 penalty on the combat maneuver check rather than the normal -10.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/122}

>When you initiate a grapple with a whip, you can spend 5 stamina points to attempt a second grapple check as a swift action to either move or damage the creature you are grappling. This is not a check to maintain the grapple.

greater_wild_empathy.name: Greater Wild Empathy
description: ## Greater Wild Empathy
{SOURCE Ultimate Magic/152}
Your natural empathy stretches across the world of nature.
**Prerequisites:** Knowledge (nature) 5 ranks, {ability/wild empathy} class feature.

**Benefit:** You gain a +2 insight bonus on wild empathy checks, and you may use wild empathy to duplicate an Intimidate check rather than a Diplomacy check. In addition, choose one of the following kinds of creatures: elementals, fey, lycanthropes, plants, or vermin. You may influence creatures of that type with wild empathy, if their Intelligence score is 1 or 2, or they do not possess an Intelligence score. Once you choose the type of creature, it cannot be changed.
**Special:** You may select this feat more than once. Each time, you may choose an additional creature type to influence.

greater_wilding_strike.name: Greater Wilding Strike
description: ## Greater Wilding Strike (Combat)
{SOURCE Ultimate Wilderness/113}
You reach the pinnacle of your wilding strike abilities.
**Prerequisites:** Str 18, {feat/Improved Unarmed Strike}, {feat/Improved Wilding Strike}, {feat/Wilding}, {feat/Wilding Strike}, base attack bonus +16.

**Benefit:** The damage die of your unarmed strikes increases to 1d10 (or 1d8 if you are Small). This does not stack with any other effects that increase the damage die of your unarmed strikes, including levels in classes such as {class/monk}. Increases to your actual size category (such as {spell/enlarge person}) still increase your damage die as normal.

green_faith_acolyte.name: Green Faith Acolyte
description: ## Green Faith Acolyte
{SOURCE Inner Sea World Guide/287;Guide to Darkmoon Vale/60;Pathfinder Campaign Setting/218}
You have trained to channel your magical energies in ways that do not harm the natural world around you.
**Prerequisites:** Follower of the {faith/Green Faith}.

**Benefit:** Spells you cast that deal damage, {ability/channel negative energy}, or otherwise harm life do not hurt normal or magical plants. In addition, whenever you cast a spell that utilizes, heals, or enhances normal or magical plants (such as {spell/entangle} or {spell/plant growth}), you cast the spell at +1 caster level.

green_tongue.name: Green Tongue
description: ## Green Tongue
{SOURCE Ultimate Wilderness/13}
You know the language of the plants.
**Prerequisites:** Cha 13, character level 5th, {race/gathlain}.
**Benefit:** You can cast {spell/speak with plants} once per day, as a spell-like ability. At 10th level and every 5 levels thereafter, you can cast speak with plants an additional time per day.

grenade_expert.name: Grenade Expert
description: ## Grenade Expert
{SOURCE Pathfinder #115: Trail of the Hunted/74}
You are skilled at both manufacturing and using alchemical grenades.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Throw Anything}.

**Benefit:** When you light an alchemical grenade (such as a {eq-weapon/fuse grenade}, {eq-weapon/pellet grenade}, or {eq-weapon/sting grenade}) you select how many rounds later the grenade explodes (minimum 1 round, maximum 3 rounds). In addition, you gain a +4 bonus on Craft (alchemy) checks to craft grenades.
**Normal:** Alchemical grenades explode 1d3 rounds after the fuse is lit.

grisly_ornament.name: Grisly Ornament
description: ## Grisly Ornament (Item Creation)
{SOURCE Monster Hunter's Handbook/24}
You adorn your gear with mementos from your foes.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Harvest Parts}.

**Benefit:** You can attempt a Craft or Heal check to craft a special type of trophy called an ornament from part of a creature that's been dead for less than an hour. You take a -4 penalty on this check if you or an ally didn't slay the creature. You can craft one ornament per character level per day. Each corpse provides enough material for one ornament plus one additional ornament per size category above Medium. You can wear one ornament in each magic item slot not already occupied by another item. When you craft an ornament, you choose whether it affects Armor Class, attack rolls, CMB, CMD, saving throws, or skill checks. The ornament provides a morale bonus equal to the monster's CR divided by 4 (round down, minimum 1) to the selected statistic against creatures of the same creature type as the source of the ornament. This bonus increases by 1 against creatures of the exact same variety (so a red dragon's talon provides the increased bonus against red dragons but not all dragons). An ornament remains effective for 1 day, plus 1 additional day for every 5 by which you exceed the DC to craft it. You can give ornaments to others, but gifted ornaments have a morale bonus equal to the monster's CR divided by 6 (round down, minimum 0) and remain effective for only 24 hours.
Also see: {eq-misc/display stand}.

groom.name: Groom
description: ## Groom
{SOURCE Ultimate Intrigue/132}
You recruit a professional groom to care for your mount.
**Prerequisites:** Character level 4th.

**Benefit:** This feat is similar to the {feat/Leadership} feat, with several exceptions to note. You can attract only a 1st-level cohort (referred to hereafter as a groom) with this feat, and cannot recruit followers of his own. You determine your Leadership score according to the rules presented in the {feat/Leadership} feat, but your groom is always at least 3 levels lower than your level.
A groom can take levels in bard, fighter, or ranger. A groom can't multiclass, though he can take any archetype for which he qualifies.

A groom finds the best place to stable and conceal your mount and the mounts of up to five allies while you and your allies are elsewhere. A groom adds half his level (minimum 1) to Stealth checks when concealing himself and any mounts that are left in his care. A groom also gains the ability to speak with animals as a supernatural ability, but he can use this ability only with horses, riding dogs, and other mounts of the animal type.

If a groom gains enough XP to bring him to 2 levels lower than your level, he doesn't gain the new level until you gain your next level; until you advance, his XP total remains 1 less than the amount needed to attain the next level.
If you release your groom from service or otherwise lose your groom, you can recruit a new one. At 7th level, you can swap this feat for the {feat/Leadership} feat.

ground_grabber.name: Ground-Grabber
description: ## Ground-Grabber (Combat)
{SOURCE Giant Hunter's Handbook/23}
When pressed by big opponents, you hunker down to more easily keep your feet.
**Prerequisites:** Con 13.
**Benefit:** You gain a +2 competence bonus to your Combat Maneuver Defense against awesome blow, bull rush, drag, reposition, or trip combat maneuvers from opponents larger than you.

groundling.name: Groundling
description: ## Groundling
{SOURCE Advanced Player's Guide/162}
You can speak with burrowing animals.
**Prerequisites:** Cha 13, {race/gnome}, gnome magic racial trait.

**Benefit:** You can use {spell/speak with animals} as a spell-like ability at will, but only to communicate with burrowing animals like gophers, moles, and the like. You can still use your gnome speak with animals ability once per day to speak with any animal, as usual.

group_deliver_touch_spells.name: Group Deliver Touch Spells
description: ## Group Deliver Touch Spells (Teamwork)
{SOURCE Familiar Folio/18}
You and your teammates can deliver touch spells through each other's familiars.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Group Shared Spells}, must have a {ability/familiar} with the share spells and deliver touch spells abilities.

**Benefit:** You and any allies with this feat can cast spells through one another's familiars as though each ally had the share spells ability with each other familiar. This feat otherwise functions as the share spells ability.

group_shared_spells.name: Group Shared Spells
description: ## Group Shared Spells (Teamwork)
{SOURCE Ultimate Wilderness/113;Familiar Folio/18}
You and your allies can cast spells through each other's familiars as if they were your own.
**Prerequisites:** {ability/Familiar} with the share spells ability.

**Benefit:** You and any of your allies with this feat can cast spells with a target of "you" on each other's familiars as touch spells. Both the target familiar and that familiar's master must be willing for the spell to take effect. You can cast spells on each other's familiars even if the spells would not normally affect creatures of the targeted familiar's type.

grow_plant_creature.name: Grow Plant Creature
description: ## Grow Plant Creature (Item Creation)
{SOURCE Cohorts and Companions/20}
Through careful study and communion with nature, you have learned how to cultivate and raise plant creatures.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Train Plants}, Handle Animal 5 ranks, Knowledge (nature) 5 ranks.
Each plant creature has a list of additional prerequisites, costs, and skill checks required to grow them. At the GM's discretion, characters with this feat may grow other plant creatures as well.
### Growing Plant Creatures

The process of growing a plant companion is very similar to the process of {family/growing a |leshy}. The creator begins by growing an array of especially verdant plants, and then performs rituals to have a spirit of nature inhabit it. Typically, the creator is a powerful druid, but anyone capable of making the required Knowledge checks and casting the required spells may attempt the process.

Cultivated minions closely resemble more familiar plant creatures - and share the same stat blocks - but are approximated copies woven from horticulture and magic. An "assassin vine" cultivated by a druid using the Grow Plant Creature feat isn't a true assassin vine, and the seeds it produces would sprout into mundane ivy, grape vines, or similar vines originally used to construct it. At the GM's discretion, this may allow druids to grow plant minions with special abilities, such as a peach treant who produces fruit or a viper vine woven from stinging nettles whose touch causes burning welts. Such adjustments should always increase the cost to create a plant creature, and should adjust their challenge rating if they greatly expand the minion's combat abilities or utility.

Growing a plant creature takes 2 weeks per Hit Die, during which the creator must fertilize, water, and protect the growth. During this period, the creator must use certain rare nutrients and fertilizer to prime the transformation from a normal plant into a plant creature; the cost of these components varies according to the type, but is never less than 1,000 gp per Hit Die. The cultivator must succeed at a Knowledge (nature) check at this time in order to properly form the plant body; the exact check as well as the required DC varies according to the creature. If the check fails, the plant withers and dies and the cultivator must begin anew.

If the skill check is successful, the cultivator must then perform a 24-hour awakening ritual. During this ritual, the cultivator must cast the spells detailed in each individual creature's entry. At the awakening ritual's climax, there is a flat 50% chance that the attempt to create the creature succeeds - if this final check fails, no appropriate spirit is close enough to answer the call. The plant body becomes dormant, and remains so for 3 months. After this time, another awakening ritual can be performed (requiring another 1,000 gp of materials); this new ritual also has a flat 50% chance of success. At the GM's discretion, the awakening ritual's chance for success might increase to 75% or even 100% in natural and unspoiled environments appropriate to the individual creature. Discovering such a rare and magical site should be the focus of its own adventure. If the awakening ritual is successful, the creature awakens fully formed. A freshly created plant creature is under no particular compulsion to obey its creator, but most regard their makers as friends and allies.

Plant creatures are particularly adept at growing other plant creatures of the same type. Sentient creatures of the plant type gain a +5 racial bonus on their Knowledge (nature) checks to cultivate other plant creatures, halve the time required to grow the creature, and reduce the materials cost by 25%. A plant creature improves the success chance of any awakening ritual it personally performs by 5% per Hit Die it possesses.

At the GM's discretion, it may be possible to create plant creatures with more Hit Dice than normal. Each additional Hit Die adds 2,250 gp to the cost of creating it (and thus 4,500 gp to the overall price), increases the DC of the Knowledge check by 2, and requires an additional 2 weeks of growth.
::h3[Assassin Vine]{jl}
An {monster/assassin vine} is usually grown deep in a forest or swamp, although it's possible to cultivate an assassin vine among overgrown grape vines if the area is shaded from direct sun.
**Price** 7,750 gp
#### Ritual
**Requirements** Grow Plant Creature, Knowledge (nature) 5 ranks, {spell/entangle}, {spell/summon nature's ally IV}; **Skill Check** Knowledge (nature) DC 16
::h3[Treant]{jl}
The ancient knowledge and wisdom possessed by the spirit of a {monster/treant} is unmatched. A treant is usually grown in a grove of ancient trees of the predominant local variety.
**Price** 25,750 gp
#### Ritual
**Requirements** Grow Plant Creature, Knowledge (nature) 10 ranks, Knowledge (geography or history) 4 ranks, {spell/liveoak}, {spell/speak with plants}; **Skill Check** Knowledge (nature) DC 24
::h3[Viper Vine]{jl}
Terrifying and deadly, {monster/viper vine/s} make excellent guardians. A viper vine is usually grown in jungles or swamps.
**Price** 43,750 gp
#### Ritual
**Requirements** Grow Plant Creature, Knowledge (nature) 12 ranks, {spell/entangle}, {spell/summon nature's ally VII}; **Skill Check** Knowledge (nature) DC 32

growth_in_ash.name: Growth in Ash
description: ## Growth in Ash
{SOURCE Elemental Master's Handbook/6}
You're aware that when fire passes, growth can begin.

**Benefit:** When you succeed at a Reflex save to avoid {rule/catching on fire}, or when you cease taking ongoing fire damage from a spell or effect, you can smear ash on yourself as an immediate action to gain {umr/fast healing} 1 for 3 rounds. For every Hit Die you have beyond 3, extend the duration of this fast healing by an additional round.

grudge_fighter.name: Grudge Fighter
description: ## Grudge Fighter (Combat)
{SOURCE Advanced Race Guide/141}
You feel great anger at anyone who dares to attack you, and this fury makes your own attacks that much stronger.
**Prerequisites:** {race/Orc}.
**Benefit:** You gain a +1 morale bonus on attack and damage rolls made against any creature that attacked you in the current combat.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/122}
>When you hit a creature that attacked you in the current combat, you can spend up to 2 stamina points to deal an amount of extra damage to it equal to double the number of stamina points you spent.

gruesome_butcher.name: Gruesome Butcher
description: ## Gruesome Butcher (Story)
{SOURCE Agents of Evil/9}
You dedicated yourself to the cause of slaughter against a specific group or people, either for country, for vengeance, or perhaps just for sport.

**Prerequisites:** You must have been rendered unconscious and left for dead on a battlefield between warring factions or have the Child Soldier (early event) or Drafted (conflict) [background](rule/bad_beginnings).

**Benefit:** Select a particular nation, organization, or humanoid subtype (such as Cheliax, [Eagle Knights](rule/aff_vangard), or goblinoids). You gain a +4 bonus on Sense Motive checks to determine whether a given creature is affiliated with that group and a +4 bonus on Bluff and Diplomacy checks to conceal your animosity toward members of that group.
**Goal:** Deliver the killing blow to a number of your hated foes whose combined Hit Dice total is equal to 10 × your current character level.

**Completion Benefit:** You gain a +2 bonus on Bluff, Knowledge, Perception, Sense Motive, and Survival checks against foes of your selected type, and a +2 bonus on weapon attack and damage rolls against them. These bonuses stack with a ranger's {ability/favored enemy} bonuses.

**Special:** By meeting the goal of this feat, your name becomes known to your enemy. Creatures of your chosen enemy faction gain a +1 morale bonus on attack and damage rolls against you should they become aware of your identity with a successful Knowledge (local) check (DC = 10 + your character level).

gruesome_shapechanger.name: Gruesome Shapechanger
description: ## Gruesome Shapechanger (Monster)
{SOURCE Horror Adventures/88}
When you change shape, it is a violent and bloody affair.
**Prerequisites:** Shapechanger subtype.

**Benefit:** When you change shape, your previous form sloughs off your body in a spray of blood and viscera that congeals into a thick, disgusting slime that dissolves within 24 hours. Until the slime dissolves or is cleaned in some way, the space where you stood when you changed (or the space below if you changed in mid-air) becomes slippery, counting as difficult terrain and increasing the DC of {skill/Acrobatics} checks made in that area by 5. Any foe witnessing this gruesome shape change must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your Hit Dice + your Constitution modifier) or be {misc/sickened} for 1 minute.

**Special:** The gruesome way you change shape is tiring. Once you've used your change shape ability, you must wait 1d4 rounds before you can use it again. If you take this feat, it changes the way your shapechanging ability works; you cannot choose to avoid this feat's effects.

gruesome_slaughter.name: Gruesome Slaughter
description: ## Gruesome Slaughter (Combat)
{SOURCE Advanced Class Guide/150}
You can inspire extreme revulsion when you slaughter your enemies.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Intimidating Prowess}, {feat/Killing Flourish}, Intimidate 11 ranks, slayer level 11th.

**Benefit:** Creatures you demoralize by using the Killing Flourish feat must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your character level + the higher of your Strength or Dexterity modifier) or become {misc/sickened} for 1 minute.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/122}
>When using this feat, you can spend up to 5 stamina points to increase the DC of the effect by an amount equal to the number of stamina points you spent.

guarded_charge.name: Guarded Charge
description: ## Guarded Charge (Combat, Shield Mastery)
{SOURCE Armor Master's Handbook/18}
Your raised shield protects you as you charge forward.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Shield Focus}, base attack bonus +6 or fighter level 4th.

**Benefit:** When performing a bull rush or overrun combat maneuver as part of a charge, you don't provoke an attack of opportunity for that maneuver. If you already have the {feat/Improved Bull Rush} or {feat/Improved Overrun} feats, you gain an additional +2 bonus on your combat maneuver check when attempting the respective maneuver.

**Special:** This feat counts as having a Strength score of 13 and {feat/Power Attack} for the purposes of meeting the prerequisites of Improved Bull Rush and Improved Overrun, and for feats that require either of those two feats as prerequisites.

guardian_of_the_wild.name: Guardian of the Wild
description: ## Guardian of the Wild
{SOURCE Advanced Race Guide/28}
Your mystic connection with the wilderness enhances your ability to react to threats.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Attuned to the Wild}, {race/elf}.

**Benefit:** When you are in a terrain type you have selected the Attuned to the Wild feat for, you gain a +2 dodge bonus to Armor Class. If you are in an area that qualifies as more than one kind of terrain, these bonuses do not stack; you receive the bonus for only one of the terrain types.

guardian_of_tradition.name: Guardian of Tradition
description: ## Guardian of Tradition
{SOURCE Inner Sea Monster Codex/35}
Your deity rewards your devotion to the duty of your race.
**Prerequisites:** Domain class feature, {monster/girtablilu}.

**Benefit:** You can replace one of the domains offered by your deity with one of the following druid domains: {druiddomain/Desert}, {druiddomain/Ruins}, or {druiddomain/Vermin}. You gain a +1 bonus to your caster level when casting domain spells from the selected domain.

guardians_return.name: Guardian's Return
description: ## Guardian's Return (Familiar)
{SOURCE Familiar Folio/19}
Your familiar can teleport to you when you're in need.
**Prerequisites:** Must have a {ability/familiar} with the {arc-familiar/protector} archetype.

**Benefit:** Once per day when you take damage from a melee attack, as long as your familiar is within empathic link range, it can teleport back to your square as an immediate action. It can bring no more than 5 pounds of items with it when it teleports in this way. This ability otherwise functions as {spell/dimension door}.

guided_hand.name: Guided Hand
description: ## Guided Hand
{SOURCE Ultimate Combat/103}
Your deity blesses any strike you make with that deity's favored weapon.
**Prerequisites:** {ability/Channel energy} class feature, {feat/Channel Smite}, proficiency with your deity's favored weapon.
**Benefit:** With your deity's favored weapon, you can use your Wisdom modifier instead of your Strength or Dexterity modifier on attack rolls.
### Mythic Guided Hand
{SOURCE Mythic Adventures/66}
Attacks made with your deity's favored weapon are divinely inspired.
**Prerequisites:** Guided Hand.
**Benefit:** When making attacks with your deity's favored weapon, you can add your Wisdom modifier instead of your Strength or Dexterity modifier on damage rolls.

guided_star.name: Guided Star
description: ## Guided Star (Combat)
{SOURCE Paths of the Righteous/29}
The grace of Desna guides your starknife to its target and back to your hand.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Starry Grace}, worshiper of {faith/Desna}.

**Benefit:** You can empower a {eq-weapon/starknife} with magical power once per day per character level as a swift action. Until the end of your turn, add your Wisdom modifier to your damage rolls with the starknife in addition to any other modifiers you normally add. If you throw the starknife during that time, it returns to you at the beginning of your next turn (as per the {magic-enh/returning} weapon special ability).

guild_emissary.name: Guild Emissary
description: ## Guild Emissary
{SOURCE Heroes of the Streets/29}
Not only are you associated with a powerful thieves' guild or similar shadowy group, you are well-enough connected to gain benefits when dealing with the underworld in any settlement.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Leadership} or {feat/Underworld Connections} (see below).

**Benefit:** You can attempt a special character level check (1d20 + your Charisma modifier + your character level) in place of a {skill/Diplomacy} check when attempting to gather information. You can ask local contacts to find information for you. While this still takes the normal amount of time (typically 1d4 hours), you can gather information about multiple topics at once (up to a maximum number of topics equal to 3 + your Charisma bonus).

Additionally, when you are in a {rule/the_<settlement>_stat_block} no smaller than a small city and are seeking a magic item with a value equal to or less than the city's base value and the item is not available, you can check again after 1 day (rather than 1 week).

If using the {rule/contact[ rule]s} you gain a single reliable contact each time you enter a settlement no smaller than a small city. This contact is randomly determined to be a fence, gossip, manipulator, merchant, petty criminal, snitch, or thug. The contact operates only within that city, and if the contact's {rule/Trust/ score} goes down, it immediately drops to 1.

gun_twirling.name: Gun Twirling
description: ## Gun Twirling (Grit)
{SOURCE Champions of Balance/19}
You can spin and juggle a small firearm, making it difficult to predict where you will shoot.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Amateur Gunslinger} feat or grit class feature, {feat/Dazzling Display}, {feat/Weapon Focus}.

**Benefit:** You can spend 1 grit point to make a {rule/feint} attempt using a one-handed firearm for which you have {feat/Weapon Focus} (instead of a melee weapon). The target of this feint must be within 30 feet of you and be able to see you.
If you have the {feat/Quick Draw} feat, you can holster a one-handed firearm as a free action as long as you have at least 1 grit point.

gunsmithing.name: Gunsmithing
description: ## Gunsmithing
{SOURCE Ultimate Combat/103}
You know the secrets of repairing and restoring firearms.

**Benefit:** If you have access to a {eq-misc/gunsmith's kit}, you can create and restore firearms, craft bullets, and mix black powder for all types of firearms. You do not need to make a Craft check to create firearms and ammunition or to restore firearms.

**Crafting Firearms:** You can craft any early {main/equipment_<firearm>s} for a cost in raw materials equal to half the price of the firearm. At your GM's discretion, you can craft advanced firearms for a cost in raw materials equal to half the price of the firearm. Crafting a firearm in this way takes 1 day of work for every 1,000 gp of the firearm's price (minimum 1 day).

**Crafting Ammunition:** You can craft {eq-weapon/bullet/s}, {eq-weapon/pellets}, and {eq-weapon/black powder} for a cost in raw materials equal to 10% of the price. If you have at least 1 rank in Craft (alchemy), you can craft {eq-weapon/alchemical cartridge/s} for a cost in raw materials equal to half the price of the cartridge. At your GM's discretion, you can craft metal cartridges for a cost in raw materials equal to half the cost of the cartridge. Crafting bullets, black powder, or cartridges takes 1 day of work for every 1,000 gp of ammunition (minimum 1 day).

**Restoring a Broken Firearm:** Each day, with an hour's worth of work, you can use this feat to repair a single firearm with the broken condition. You can take time during a rest period to restore a broken firearm with this feat.

**Special:** If you are a {class/gunslinger}, this feat grants the following additional benefit. You can use this feat to repair and restore your initial, battered weapon. It costs 300 gp and 1 day of work to upgrade it to a {rule/masterwork>_weapons} firearm of its type.

half_drow_paragon.name: Half-Drow Paragon
description: ## Half-Drow Paragon
{SOURCE Advanced Race Guide/47}
Your drow blood is particularly strong.
**Prerequisites:** Drow-blooded and drow magic racial traits, {race/half-elf}.

**Benefit:** You count as a drow for any effects that relate to race. Furthermore, the spell-like abilities granted to you by your drow magic racial trait count as drow spell-like abilities for the purposes of any feat prerequisites.

halfling_slinger.name: Halfling Slinger
description: ## Halfling Slinger (Combat)
{SOURCE Halflings of Golarion/23}
You have honed your racial talent for slingcraft.
**Prerequisites:** {race/Halfling}.
**Benefit:** You gain a +1 racial bonus on attack rolls made using a {eq-weapon/sling}.

hamatula_grasp.name: Hamatula Grasp
description: ## Hamatula Grasp (Combat)
{SOURCE Cheliax, Empire of Devils/27}
You deal terrible damage to impaled foes.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Hamatula Strike}, {feat/Improved Grapple}, Strength 13, base attack bonus +9.
**Benefit:** When attacking an impaled opponent with the weapon that impales them, you only suffer a -2 penalty to your grapple check. If the check succeeds, you deal an extra 1d6 damage.

hamatula_strike.name: Hamatula Strike
description: ## Hamatula Strike (Combat)
{SOURCE Cheliax, Empire of Devils/27}
You can catch your opponents on your weapon and hold them in place.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Improved Grapple}, Strength 13, Base Attack Bonus +7.

**Benefit:** Whenever you damage an opponent with a piercing weapon, you can immediately make a {rule/grapple} check; success means the opponent is impaled on your weapon and you both gain the grappled condition. While the opponent is impaled, as an attack action you may make a grapple check on your turn at a -4 penalty to damage the opponent with your weapon, even if your weapon cannot normally be used in a grapple.
**Normal:** You can only attack with an unarmed strike, natural weapon, or light weapon against opponents you are grappling.

hamatulatsu.name: Hamatulatsu
description: ## Hamatulatsu (Combat)
{SOURCE Inner Sea World Guide/287;Pathfinder Campaign Setting/83}
You have mastered a deadly fighting form inspired by the hideous attacks of the {monster/barbed devil}.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Improved Unarmed Strike}.

**Benefit:** Your unarmed attacks can deal either bludgeoning or piercing damage. You decide which type of damage you deal whenever you attack a foe, but you may only choose one type at a time. If you critically hit a foe with your unarmed strike while doing piercing damage, the additional pain caused by the strike causes the foe to become {misc/sickened} for 1 round (or {misc/staggered} for 1 round if the target is already sickened). Multiple critical hits in a round against a single foe do not increase the duration of the sickened or staggered condition.

**Special:** Hamatulatsu may be selected as a substitute bonus feat at 6th level by a monk even if the monk does not otherwise meet the prerequisites. This fighting style is normally only taught to women of the Sisterhood of the Golden Erinyes.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Weapon Master's Handbook/25}
>By spending 5 stamina points, you can treat a hit with an unarmed strike as a critical hit for the purpose of determining the benefits that you gain from Hamatulatsu.

hammer_guards_the_anvil.name: Hammer Guards the Anvil
description: ## Hammer Guards the Anvil (Teamwork)
{SOURCE Elemental Master's Handbook/7}
Your allies cover you when your guard is down.

**Benefit:** Creatures threatened by an ally with this feat cannot make attacks of opportunity against you when you pick up an item from the ground, retrieve a stored item, sheathe a weapon, or stand up from prone.

hammer_the_gap.name: Hammer the Gap
description: ## Hammer the Gap (Combat)
{SOURCE Ultimate Combat/103}
You repeatedly strike the same location, causing increasing amounts of damage.
**Prerequisites:** Base attack bonus +6.

**Benefit:** When you take a full-attack action, each consecutive hit against the same opponent deals extra damage equal to the number of previous consecutive hits you have made against that opponent this turn. This damage is multiplied on a critical hit.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/122}
>When you use this feat, you can spend 5 stamina points to increase the amount of extra damage dealt by 1 point per consecutive hit you make.

hammer_throw.name: Hammer Throw
description: ## Hammer Throw (Combat)
{SOURCE Heroes from the Fringe/9}
You can throw a hammer with such force that it knocks your foes over.
**Prerequisites:** Int 13, {feat/Combat Expertise}, {feat/Improved Trip}, {feat/Precise Shot}, base attack bonus +1, {race/dwarf}.

**Benefit:** As a standard action, you can make a single ranged attack with a weapon that deals bludgeoning damage against a creature no more than one size category larger than you that is within the weapon's first range increment. If you hit and damage the target, you can immediately attempt to perform a {rule/trip} combat maneuver against that target. This does not provoke an attack of opportunity, and if your combat maneuver check fails by 10 or more, you do not fall prone.

hands_autonomy.name: Hand's Autonomy
description: ## Hand's Autonomy
{SOURCE Haunted Heroes Handbook/24}
Your possessed hand can act independently.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Possessed Hand}.

**Benefit:** You reduce the penalties for {rule/fighting with |two weapon/s>_fighting} (including fighting with double weapons or when throwing weapons from each hand) by 2, to a minimum penalty of -1. This benefit stacks with the {feat/Two-Weapon Fighting} feat. When you are unconscious, paralyzed, asleep, or stunned, your possessed hand can still act on your behalf in a limited fashion. The hand uses your statistics when performing any action in this manner. The hand can't take attacks of opportunity, but can draw attacks of opportunity from actions it takes. The hand can perform the following actions each turn on your initiative count.
- The hand can retrieve or pick up an item or weapon as a standard action.
- The hand can attempt any of the following skill checks at a -4 penalty: Disable Device, Escape Artist, Heal, Sleight of Hand, or Use Magic Device.
- The hand can knock you {rule/prone} as a free action, and drag you while you're prone at a speed of 5 feet as a full-round action.
- The hand can perform any other action appropriate for a hand and an arm, such as pouring a held potion into your mouth or awakening you from a {spell/sleep} spell.
- The hand can make a single melee or ranged attack with a light or one-handed weapon as a full-round action.

hands_detachment.name: Hand's Detachment
description: ## Hand's Detachment
{SOURCE Haunted Heroes Handbook/24}

Your possessed hand can painlessly pull free of your body or reattach itself, leaving you with a bloodless but raw-looking stump at the end of one arm while the hand itself performs remote tasks under your command, acting in many ways like a strange familiar.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Hand's Autonomy}, {feat/Possessed Hand}.

**Benefit:** You can remove your possessed hand, allowing the possessing spirit to animate and control its motion. Removing or reattaching your possessed hand is a full-round action. This deals no damage to you, but you can't use the hand while it is removed. The hand acts as a wizard's {ability/familiar}, using your character level as your effective wizard level, except it doesn't gain the alertness, share spells, deliver touch spells, spell resistance, or scry on familiar abilities. Use the statistics for a {monster/crawling hand} to represent the detached hand, save that the hand isn't undead, doesn't have the mark quarry ability, and shares your alignment. If the hand is destroyed, the spirit regenerates your missing hand in 2d4 days. This process can be accelerated by {spell/regenerate} or similar magic. You cannot use the Possessed Hand feat or any feat with the Possessed Hand feat as a prerequisite until the hand is fully regenerated. If you have the familiar class feature, you can choose for your possessed hand to become your {sidekick/familiar}, granting it all familiar abilities as normal. If selected as a familiar, your possessed hand grants you a +3 bonus on Sleight of Hand checks.

hands_knowledge.name: Hand's Knowledge
description: ## Hand's Knowledge
{SOURCE Haunted Heroes Handbook/24}
The connection to the memories of the spirit possessing your hand deepens.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Possessed Hand}.

**Benefit:** Select one Knowledge skill; this skill becomes a class skill for you. Additionally, select one of the following skills: Disable Device, Escape Artist, Heal, Sleight of Hand, or Use Magic Device. This skill becomes a class skill for you and you can attempt checks with the skill untrained. Once per day as a swift action, you can gain a bonus to any of the above skill checks equal to 1/2 your character level.

hands_of_valor.name: Hands of Valor
description: ## Hands of Valor
{SOURCE Inner Sea Gods/212}
Your touch staunches wounds and inspires great deeds.
**Prerequisites:** {ability/Lay on hands} class feature, worshiper of {faith/Iomedae}.

**Benefit:** Once per day when you use lay on hands, you can also imbue that ally with valor. In addition to the normal effects of your lay on hands, the targeted ally gains a sacred bonus on attack rolls and on saves against fear effects equal to your Charisma bonus (minimum +1) for 1 minute.

hands_sight.name: Hand's Sight
description: ## Hand's Sight
{SOURCE Haunted Heroes Handbook/25}
By manifesting an eerie, spiritual eye of its own, your possessed hand can "see" on your behalf.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Possessed Hand}.
**Benefit:** While your possessed hand isn't carrying anything, you gain darkvision with a range of 60 feet and cannot be {rule/flank/ed>ing}.

harder_they_fall.name: Harder They Fall
description: ## Harder They Fall (Combat, Teamwork)
{SOURCE Ultimate Wilderness/113;Giant Hunter's Handbook/19}
You can work with an ally to move or knock over a foe that's too large for either of you to overcome alone.
**Prerequisites:** Str 13, Int 13, {feat/Combat Expertise}, {feat/Power Attack}.

**Benefit:** When you use the {rule/aid another>_2} action to grant an ally who also has this feat a +2 bonus on a {rule/bull rush} or {rule/trip} combat maneuver check, the ally can attempt that maneuver even against foes two or more size categories larger than herself.

hard_headed.name: Hard-Headed
description: ## Hard-Headed (Combat)
{SOURCE Advanced Race Guide/18}
Your thick skull is almost a weapon unto itself.
**Prerequisites:** Base attack bonus +1, {race/dwarf}.

**Benefit:** You gain a +1 bonus on attack rolls and combat maneuver checks made using a helmet. You receive a +2 bonus on saves against spells and special abilities that cause you to become {misc/staggered} or {misc/stunned}.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/122}

>When targeted by a spell or a special ability that could cause you to become staggered or stunned, you can spend up to 2 stamina points before attempting the save to gain a bonus on the saving throw equal to the number of stamina points you spent.

hardy_liver.name: Hardy Liver
description: ## Hardy Liver
{SOURCE Inner Sea Taverns/59}
You can hold your liquor and poisons better than most.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Great Fortitude}.

**Benefit:** You gain a +2 bonus on Fortitude saving throws against ingested poisons. You take no penalties when you are tipsy, and the penalties for being {rule/drunk/ or soused>enness} are halved for you.

harmonic_sage.name: Harmonic Sage
description: ## Harmonic Sage
{SOURCE Ultimate Combat/104}
Your thorough understanding of acoustics in artificial surroundings allows you to improve the power of your bardic performance.
**Prerequisites:** {ability/Bardic performance} class feature, Knowledge (engineering) 5 ranks.

**Benefit:** While inside an artificial structure, you can spend a free action to make a DC 15 Knowledge (engineering) check when you begin your bardic performance. Success on this check allows you to do one of the following.
>@HL[Self-Harmonize:] By performing over the acoustic reverberations of your performance, you increase the DC of your bardic performance effects +1.
